definition[0]: to send work to other people instead of doing it yourself
example[0]: The processing will be farmed out to people in local villages.
definition[1]: to send someone to a different place where they will be looked after – used to show disapproval
example[1]: At the age of 16 she was farmed out to family friends.
definition[2]: to send work to other people, especially people outside your company, instead of doing it yourself
example[2]: Some of the work can be farmed out to freelancers.
